gurmukhi: god dXo jsuDw qb qwky su AMq smY qb hI aun lIno ]Bwg bfy durbuDn ky Bgvwnih kO ijn AsQn dIno ]
transliteration: God Dayo Jasudhaa Tab Taake Su Ant Samai Tab Hioun Leeno|| Bhaag Hade Durbudhan Ke Bhagvaagvaanah(i) Kau Jin Asthan Deeno||
translation: Then Yashoda put Krishna in her lap and in this way Putana called her own end; that woman of vicious intellect had been very fortunate because she made the Lord to drink milk from her teats;

gurmukhi: CIr rk`qR su AYc qwhI ky pRwn su AYc ley muK mo ieh kIno ]ijau ggVI qumrI qn lwiekY qyl ley quc CwfkY pIno ]87]
transliteration: Chheer Rakattra Su Aich Taahike Praan Su Aich Lae Moukh Mo Eh Keeno|| Jio Gaddi Toumritan Laae-kai Tel Lae Touch Chhaadkai Pino||87||
translation: Krishna sucked her blood (instead of milk) with his mouth alongwith his life-force like the pressing and filtering the oil from the colocynth.87.

gurmukhi: pwp kirE bhu pUqnw jwso nrk frwie ]AMq kihXo hir Cwif dY bsI ibkuMTh jwie ]88]
transliteration: Paap Kario Bahu Pootanaa Jaaso Narak Daraae|| Ant Kahiyo Bar(i) Chhaad(i) Dai Basibikounthah Jaae||88||
translation: Putana committed such a great sin, which may even frighten the hell, while dying she said, “O Krishna! Leave me,” and saying this much she went to heaven.88.

gurmukhi: dyih iC kos pRmwn BeI puKrw ijm pyt muKo nlUAwry ]fMf dukUl Bey iqhky jnu bwr isbwl qy syK pUAwry ]
transliteration: Deh(i) Chhe Kos Pramaan Bhaipoukhraa Jim Pet Moukho Naloodare|| Dand Douknl Bhae Tihke Jan(u) Baar Sibaal Te Sekh Poodare||
translation: The body of Putana grew as long as six kos; her belly looked like a tank and face like a gutter; her arms were like the two banks of the tank and hair like the scum spread on the tank;

gurmukhi: sIs sumyr ko siRMg BXo iqh AwKn mY prgy pfUAwry ]swh ky kot my qop lgI ibb goln ky hÍY gey glUAwry ]89]
transliteration: Sis Soumer Ko Sring Bhayo Tih Aakhanndmai Parge Khadoodare|| Saah Ke Kot Me To Lagibib Golan Ke Hvai Gad Gadoodare||89||
translation: Her head became like the top of the Sumeru mountain and there appeared great pits in place of her eyes; within the pits of her eyes, the eyeballs appeared like the canons fixed in the fort of king.89.

gurmukhi: AsQn muK lY kiRSn iqh aUpir soie gey ]Dwie qbY biRjlok sB god auTwie ley ]90]
transliteration: Asthan Moukh Lai Krishan Tih Oopar(i) Soe Gad|| Dhaae Tabai Brij-lok Sabh God Outhaae Lae||90||
translation: Krishna went to sleep with the teat of Putana in his mouth and the residents of Braja woke him up.90.

gurmukhi: kwt kwt qn eykTy kIXb qw ko Fyr ]dy eINDn chUM Er qy bwrq lgI n byr ]91]
transliteration: Kaat Tan Ekthe Keeyab Taa Ko Dher|| De Eendhan Chahoon Or Te Baarat Lagina Her||91||
translation: The people gathered the parts of the body of Putna and got burnt by putting fule on all the four sides.91.

gurmukhi: jb hI nMd Awie hY gokl mY leI bws su bws mhw ibsmwnXo ]lok sBY biRj ko ibrqwNq kihE suinkY mn mY frpwnXo ]
transliteration: Jah Hinand Aae Hai Gokal Mai Laibaas Mahaa Bismaanyo|| Lok Sabhai Brij Ko Birtaant Kahio Soun(i)kai Man Mai Darpaanyo||
translation: When Nand came to Gokul and knowing all that had happened, he was extremely wonder-struck; when the people told him the saga of Putna, then he also was filled with fear in his mind;
